subject: Fix support for Get Payload.
commitMessage:
Fix support for Get Payload.

Get Payload is split into two as follows:
1) Get Payload Info (ipmitool raw 0x30 0xd6 0 1):
Return info of Payload1 (pending list) data

2) Get Payload data (ipmitool raw 0x30 0xd6 1 1):
Return Payload1 (pending list) data.

Note: Pending list is the BIOS knobs edited by patch to
https://<IP>/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Bios/Settings,
which is stored in BMC.

Tested:
Step 1)
Patch to https://<IP>/redfish/v1/Systems/system/Bios/Settings
with the following data:
{
  "data":{
    "Ce2LmLoggingEn": "0x0",
    "CoreCrashLogDisable": "0x1",
    "CpuCrashLogClear": "0x0",
    "DfxEadrDebugLogs": "0x1",
    "DfxFadrDebugLogs": "0x1",
    "WheaLogMemoryEn": "0x1"
    }
}

Step 2)
Give command ipmitool raw 0x30 0xd6 0 1

Response:
 00 00 01 7e 00 00 00 08 4c d3 e9 00 01 a8 9e 00
 00

Step 3)
Give command ipmitool raw 0x30 0xd6 1 1 0x09 0 0 0 0x7e 0 0 0

Response:
 01 75 00 00 00 89 51 07 a0 69 6e 67 45 6e 3d 30
 78 30 0a 43 6f 72 65 43 72 61 73 68 4c 6f 67 44
 69 73 61 62 6c 65 3d 30 78 31 0a 43 70 75 43 72
 61 73 68 4c 6f 67 43 6c 65 61 72 3d 30 78 30 0a
 44 66 78 45 61 64 72 44 65 62 75 67 4c 6f 67 73
 3d 30 78 31 0a 44 66 78 46 61 64 72 44 65 62 75
 67 4c 6f 67 73 3d 30 78 31 0a 57 68 65 61 4c 6f
 67 4d 65 6d 6f 72 79 45 6e 3d 30 78 31 0a

Signed-off-by: Arun Lal K M <arun.lal@intel.com>
Change-Id: I6a3bec66f78c2c9b6296e3dbba7743971b372f75

instead of payload class. we can use the specific payloadtype1 class name.
Will address this.
Done
why this logic is changed ?
Looked more clean to me.
Have changed it back.
Done
Why byte order is changed ?

EPS has status before flag.

Response:
Completion Code
Byte 2:3- Payload Version
Byte 4 – Payload Type
Byte 5:8 - Total Payload length 
Byte 9: 12 – Full Payload data checksum
Byte 13-Payload Current Status
Byte 14 – Payload flag
Byte 15:18-Timestamp
Done
Please refer the command response for GetPayloadInfo

EPS has status before flag.

Response:
Completion Code
Byte 2:3- Payload Version
Byte 4 – Payload Type
Byte 5:8 - Total Payload length 
Byte 9: 12 – Full Payload data checksum
Byte 13-Payload Current Status
Byte 14 – Payload flag
Byte 15:18-Timestamp
Done
Why redfish in IPMI code? I believe its dbus not redfish.
Will address this.
Instead of this, You can strip of the "xyz.openbmc_project.BIOSConfig.Manager.AttributeType." and use it right?

Yes we can, but I still will have to check if it is "Enumeration", "String", "Password", "Integer" or "Boolean"
To check if it is none of the above and return "UNKNOWN".

Make it as first input argument
Will do.

It should be payloadData. 
Will correct this.
declare them at place of use. I.e line no:165

getPendingList?

nit: good to include ec.message() also in logs
Will address this.
if return value from mapAttrTypeToRedfish() is used only for comparison.. then better to return an int or enum.. string comparison is costly
Will address this.
I think enclosing in single quotes has perfomance benefits
Will do.
Seems logic is almost same for both if cases. Any chance we can move common logic to a separate function?
Yes, will do.
What about other types like Boolean, Password, Enumeration etc..?

We only use string and int for values of BIOS knobs. 
And I understand that this means mapAttrTypeToRedfish needs to be modified. 
I will do that too.
better to check if file is actually opened?
This should be after open status check.

Check for that is inside the write function of std::ofstream.
So open and write den do one check at line 277 to make sure there are no errors.
Same as reply given to Nidhin.
Not Clear, After open file, You need to check is that success or clear and then same applies to write.

payloadFile << patloadData has .bad check inside it, so if file was not open, this statement will just come out without doing anything. 

And line 277 we will check .good, and at that point we will get .good to be false if file was not open or if write failed. 

Adding a check after open feels redundant. But I can add the checks after open if you want.

Use good()

bad() check only badbit, Where are good() checks eofbit, failbit along with badbit.
Will do.
nit. file will be autmoatically closed in destructor
Will remove.
same as above, check good() instead of bad()
Will do.
what is the significance of 1 here?
There are two payload files, on a high level, Payload0 is for Set command and Payload1 is for Get command.

Why to allocate maximum size here, You already know the length of data what you are going to read, So use length.

Also add bundary check for length (with maxGetPayloadDataSize)
Will do.
do we need to check (maxGetPayloadDataSize > length)

Like AppaRao said I will use the correct length (in line 304), 
And put a check for maxGetPayloadDataSize > length before line 304.
payloadType ??
There are two payload types, Payload0 and Payload1

I mean in line 318, You already assigned payloadType. So you ca use that instead of cast it again here.

 uint8_t payloadType = static_cast<uint8_t>(ipmi::PType::IntelXMLType1);
Ok. Will address this.
Are these belong to old payload, I believe its not. It should be new payload data size. Correct me if i am wrong.

Payload1 will be created. 
Then the file stats of Payload1 file will be used to fill gNVOOBdata.payloadInfo[payloadType]
payloadType = 1

Not clear?

My question: as part of payloadInfo structure ( payloadTotalSize , payloadCurrentSize , actualTotalPayloadWritten ), you need to store new payload data sizes not existing file right?

This is the information of the new file. 
updatePayloadFile will update the file with new data. 
after that updatePayloadInfo is called.
And in updatePayloadInfo we take the info of the updated file and store it in gNVOOBdata.payloadInfo

The flow can be better understood from function "update" in line 365.
payloadData

enum class members should be named in lowerCamelCase as per c++ coding style and convention.
https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/cpp-style-and-conventions.md
Will address this.

if we are using std::get we need to put code in try block and also catch exception since exception can be thrown on invalid access to the value of a variant.
or std::get_if can be used instead
Line 149 is to make sure we have data as string in it. So I believe we do not need try catch.
same
Line 159 is to make sure we have data as int64_t in it. So I believe we do not need try catch.
Where are you freeing this memory? Since you used, New it won't get freed after going out of scope.

It's a unique pointer and will delete the memory as it goes out of scope.
unique_ptr<int[]> uses default_delete<int[]> as it's default deletion method.
